alert.note: Alert for Comanche; Eastland; Erath; Hamilton; Jack; Lampasas; Mills; Palo Pinto; Stephens; Young (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 17 at 1:09AM CDT until March 17 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...Critical fire weather conditions expected today near and west of U.S. Highway 281... .Warm temperatures, dry conditions, and gusty southwest winds are expected Thursday afternoon, resulting in an increasing threat for wildfires. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR VERY WARM TEMPERATURES...BREEZY SOUTHWEST WINDS...VERY LOW HUMIDITY...AND ABUNDANT DRY FUEL NEAR AND WEST OF U.S. HIGHWAY 281... The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a Red Flag Warning for critical fire weather conditions, which is in effect from noon today to 7 PM CDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Locations near and west of U.S. Highway 281. * TIMING...Thursday afternoon and early evening. * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 25 MPH with gusts up to 40 MPH. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 13 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid to lower 80s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that do develop will spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that extreme fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and dry vegetation can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Avoid all outside burning and welding today. Do not toss lit cigarette butts outside. Report wild fires to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
